author: jochembrouwer
content: Am I correct that I should thus run Prague with only 2537?

author: jochembrouwer
content: And for the EIP6110 tests above, should I run Prague only with 6110?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Nvm, can answer it myself, 6110 tests have requestsRoot and 2537 have not, so they should run in isolation ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Small Q: are the state tests the same as the blockchain tests? (Except that they are now state tests?)

author: marioevz
content: Hey so the state tests are only one tx and the blockchain tests contain multiple blocks with multiple txs each, I think we are going to primarily use blockchain tests for Prague EIPs because most of them have modifications to the block header or block level operations (except maybe 3074)

author: dimitry8570
content: Also state tests don't count block reward

author: jochembrouwer
content: The EIP 2537 tests they are taken from the EIP test vectors right?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Did any other client try to run the tests?

author: jochembrouwer
content:
We at EthereumJS are failing these tests

```
tests/prague/eip2537_bls_12_381_precompiles/test_bls12_g1add.py::test_valid[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-bls_g1add_g1_wrong_order+g1-]
tests/prague/eip2537_bls_12_381_precompiles/test_bls12_g1add.py::test_valid[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-not_in_subgroup_1-]
tests/prague/eip2537_bls_12_381_precompiles/test_bls12_g1add.py::test_valid[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-not_in_subgroup_2-]
tests/prague/eip2537_bls_12_381_precompiles/test_bls12_g2add.py::test_valid[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-bls_g2add_g2_wrong_order+g2-]
tests/prague/eip2537_bls_12_381_precompiles/test_bls12_g2add.py::test_valid[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-not_in_subgroup-]
```

author: jochembrouwer
content: For some reason these tests have the name "valid", but the names seem to imply there is something wrong. If we disable the checks if the order is valid and if the coordinates are actually on the curve, then those tests pass (but then, other tests will start to fail)

author: jochembrouwer
content: Wait a min, I might be on something

author: marioevz
content: So `bls_g1add_g1_wrong_order+g1` and `bls_g2add_g2_wrong_order+g2` were taken directly from https://github.com/ethereum/bls12-381-tests/tree/eip-2537, and `not_in_subgroup_*` are new additions in the execution-spec-tests

author: jochembrouwer
content: So for my understanding the `not_in_subgroup_*` tests, these are nums not in a subgroup but somehow they can still produce a valid output of the bls precompile? Assuming that "valid" means that the BLS call succeeds and does not throw?

author: jochembrouwer
content: And I understand absolutely nothing of this crypto, but somehow you can add g1/g2 numbers which are in the wrong order which can still succeed?

author: marioevz
content: Yes, so not in the subgroup but still on the curve, so these inputs are only valid for the addition precompile, but none of the other ones
